moves.1. e4: Interesting mate at the end of this short game.
moves.1... c5 2. d3 Nf6 3. Qf3: Not the best response, the Q is not very effective here early in the game.
moves.8... d4: Black decides to take more central space.
Necessary but White is behind in development.
moves.12... Bf5 13. Qb3: ? Another Q move. White needs to play 0-0.
moves.13... Qd7 14. Na3 Bd8: Now the bishop must be protected preventing castling.
moves.15. Nc2 Bb6 16. Nb4: Too many moves with the same pieces.
moves.16... Nxb4 17. Bxb4 Rac8 18. Kd2: ?? White wants to free the bishop but this loses quickly.
moves.20. Ba3: Otherwise the Bishop is lost, but that would have been better than what follows
moves.21. Qd1: Forced to save the Q, but now the King is lost
moves.21... Ba5+ 22. b4 axb3 e.p.+: Mate follows. White's King was trapped in the center. White resigns.
